info.title: Hetzner Cloud API
info.description: Copied from the official API documentation for the Public Hetzner Cloud.

action.title: Action

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format)

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

action.description: Actions show the results and progress of asynchronous requests to the API.

server.description: Configuration for type Server, required if type is `server`

use_private_ip.description: Use the private network IP instead of the public IP of the Server, requires the Server and Load Balancer to be in the same network. Default value is false.

label_selector.description: Configuration for label selector targets, required if type is `label_selector`

ip.description: IP of a server that belongs to the same customer (public IPv4/IPv6).

IP targets where the traffic should be routed through. Currently it is only possible to use the IPs of Hetzner Online Root Servers belonging to the project owner. IPs belonging to other users are blocked. Additionally IPs belonging to services provided by Hetzner Cloud (Servers, Load Balancers, ...) are blocked as well.

server.description: ID of the Server the Floating IP shall be assigned to

iso.description: ID or name of ISO to attach to the Server as listed in GET `/isos`

network.description: ID of an existing network to attach the Load Balancer to

ip.description: IP to request to be assigned to this Load Balancer; if you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP address

network.description: ID of an existing network to attach the Server to

ip.description: IP to request to be assigned to this Server; if you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP address

alias_ips.description: Additional IPs to be assigned to this Server

server.description: ID of the Server the Volume will be attached to

automount.description: Auto-mount the Volume after attaching it

certificate.title: Certificate

certificate.description: Certificate and chain in PEM format, in order so that each record directly certifies the one preceding

created.description: Point in time when the Certificate was created (in ISO-8601 format)

not_valid_before.description: Point in time when the Certificate becomes valid (in ISO-8601 format)

not_valid_after.description: Point in time when the Certificate stops being valid (in ISO-8601 format)

domain_names.description: Domains and subdomains covered by the Certificate

certificate.description: TLS/SSL Certificates prove the identity of a Server and are used to encrypt client traffic.

network.description: ID of an existing Network already attached to the Server

alias_ips.description: New alias IPs to set for this Server

delete.description: If true, prevents the Floating IP from being deleted
If true, prevents the snapshot from being deleted

ip_range.description: The new prefix for the whole Network

delete.description: If true, prevents the Load Balancer from being deleted
If true, prevents the Network from being deleted

ip.description: IP address for which to set the reverse DNS entry

dns_ptr.description: Hostname to set as a reverse DNS PTR entry, will reset to original default value if `null`

ip.description: Primary IP address for which the reverse DNS entry should be set

dns_ptr.description: Hostname to set as a reverse DNS PTR entry, reset to original value if `null`

delete.description: If true, prevents the Server from being deleted (currently delete and rebuild attribute needs to have the same value)

rebuild.description: If true, prevents the Server from being rebuilt (currently delete and rebuild attribute needs to have the same value)

load_balancer_type.description: ID or name of Load Balancer type the Load Balancer should migrate to

upgrade_disk.description: If false, do not upgrade the disk (this allows downgrading the Server type later)

server_type.description: ID or name of Server type the Server should migrate to

delete.description: If true, prevents the Volume from being deleted

certificate.description: Certificate and chain in PEM format, in order so that each record directly certifies the one preceding

server.description: Server to assign the Floating IP to

home_location.description: Home Location (routing is optimized for that Location). Only optional if Server argument is passed.

description.description: Description of the Image, will be auto-generated if not set

load_balancer_type.description: ID or name of the Load Balancer type this Load Balancer should be created with

public_interface.description: Enable or disable the public interface of the Load Balancer

network.description: ID of the network the Load Balancer should be attached to on creation

location.description: ID or name of Location to create Load Balancer in

ip_range.description: IP range of the whole network which must span all included subnets. Must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918. Minimum network size is /24. We highly recommend that you pick a larger network with a /16 netmask.

routes.description: Array of routes set in this network. The destination of the route must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918. The gateway must be a subnet/IP of the ip_range of the network object. The destination must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first IP of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1. The gateway cannot be the first IP of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1.

name.description: Name of the Server to create (must be unique per Project and a valid hostname as per RFC 1123)

location.description: ID or name of Location to create Server in (must not be used together with datacenter)

datacenter.description: ID or name of Datacenter to create Server in (must not be used together with location)

server_type.description: ID or name of the Server type this Server should be created with

start_after_create.description: Start Server right after creation. Defaults to true.

image.description: ID or name of the Image the Server is created from

ssh_keys.description: SSH key IDs or names which should be injected into the Server at creation time

volumes.description: Volume IDs which should be attached to the Server at the creation time. Volumes must be in the same Location.

networks.description: Network IDs which should be attached to the Server private network interface at the creation time

user_data.description: Cloud-Init user data to use during Server creation. This field is limited to 32KiB.

root_password.description: Root password when no SSH keys have been specified

size.description: Size of the Volume in GB

automount.description: Auto-mount Volume after attach. `server` must be provided.

format.description: Format Volume after creation. One of: `xfs`, `ext4`

location.description: Location to create the Volume in (can be omitted if Server is specified)

server.description: Server to which to attach the Volume once it's created (Volume will be created in the same Location as the server)

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format)

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

id.description: ID of the Server the Image was created from

name.description: Server name at the time the Image was created

created_from.description: Information about the Server the Image was created from

supported.description: IDs of Server types that are supported in the Datacenter

available.description: IDs of Server types that are supported and for which the Datacenter has enough resources left

available_for_migration.description: IDs of Server types that are supported and for which the Datacenter has enough resources left

server_types.description: The Server types the Datacenter can handle

datacenter.description: Datacenter this Server is located at

listen_port.description: The listen port of the service you want to delete

ip_range.description: IP range of subnet to delete

network.description: ID of an existing network to detach the Load Balancer from
ID of an existing network to detach the Server from

ip.description: Single IPv4 or IPv6 address | Single IPv6 address of this Server for which the reverse DNS entry has been set up

dns_ptr.description: DNS pointer for the specific IP address

type.description: Type of rescue system to boot (default: `linux64`)

ssh_keys.description: Array of SSH key IDs which should be injected into the rescue system. Only available for types: `linux64` and `linux32`.

root_password.description: Password that will be set for this Server once the Action succeeds

error.description: Error message for the Action if error occurred, otherwise null

name.description: Unique name of the Floating IP

ip.description: IP address of the Floating IP

server.description: ID of the Server the Floating IP is assigned to, null if it is not assigned at all

delete.description: If true, prevents the Floating IP from being deleted

protection.description: Protection configuration for the Floating IP

created.description: Point in time when the Floating IP was created (in ISO-8601 format)

cookie_name.description: Name of the cookie used for sticky sessions

cookie_lifetime.description: Lifetime of the cookie used for sticky sessions

certificates.description: IDs of the Certificates to use for TLS/SSL termination by the Load Balancer; empty for TLS/SSL passthrough or if `protocol` is "http"

redirect_http.description: Redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS. Only available if protocol is "https". Default `false`

sticky_sessions.description: Use sticky sessions. Only available if protocol is "http" or "https". Default `false`

http.description: Configuration option for protocols http and https

status.description: Whether the Image can be used or if it's still being created

name.description: Unique identifier of the Image. This value is only set for system Images.

image_size.description: Size of the Image file in our storage in GB. For snapshot Images this is the value relevant for calculating costs for the Image.

disk_size.description: Size of the disk contained in the Image in GB

created.description: Point in time when the Image was created (in ISO-8601 format)

bound_to.description: ID of Server the Image is bound to. Only set for Images of type `backup`.

os_flavor.description: Flavor of operating system contained in the Image

rapid_deploy.description: Indicates that rapid deploy of the Image is available

delete.description: If true, prevents the snapshot from being deleted

deprecated.description: Point in time when the Image is considered to be deprecated (in ISO-8601 format)

blocked.description: If the IP is blocked by our anti abuse dept

dns_ptr.description: Reverse DNS PTR entry for the IPv4 addresses of this Server

ipv4.description: IP address (v4) and its reverse DNS entry of this Server

blocked.description: If the IP is blocked by our anti abuse dept

dns_ptr.description: Reverse DNS PTR entries for the IPv6 addresses of this Server, `null` by default

ipv6.description: IPv6 network assigned to this Server and its reverse DNS entry

name.description: Unique identifier of the ISO. Only set for public ISOs

deprecated.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of deprecation, null if ISO is still available. After the deprecation time it will no longer be possible to attach the ISO to Servers.

name.description: Unique identifier of the ISO. Only set for public ISOs

deprecated.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of deprecation, null if ISO is still available. After the deprecation time it will no longer be possible to attach the ISO to Servers.

iso_optional.description: ISO Image that is attached to this Server. Null if no ISO is attached.

recommendation.description: The Datacenter which is recommended to be used to create new Servers.

currency.description: Currency the returned prices are expressed in, coded according to ISO 4217

vat_rate.description: The VAT rate used for calculating prices with VAT

image.description: The cost of Image per GB/month

floating_ip.description: The cost of one Floating IP per month

traffic.description: The cost of additional traffic per TB

percentage.description: Percentage by how much the base price will increase

server_backup.description: Will increase base Server costs by specific percentage

volume.description: The cost of Volume per GB/month

id.description: ID of the Server type the price is for

name.description: Name of the Server type the price is for

server_types.description: Costs of Server types per Location and type

id.description: ID of the Load Balancer type the price is for

name.description: Name of the Load Balancer type the price is for

prices.description: Load Balancer type costs per Location

load_balancer_types.description: Costs of Load Balancer types per Location and type

name.description: Unique name of the Load Balancer

delete.description: If true, prevents the Load Balancer from being deleted

protection.description: Protection configuration for the Load Balancer

created.description: Point in time when the Load Balancer was created (in ISO-8601 format)

services.description: List of services that belong to this Load Balancer

targets.description: List of targets that belong to this Load Balancer

outgoing_traffic.description: Outbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

ingoing_traffic.description: Inbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

included_traffic.description: Free Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

id.description: ID of the Load Balancer type

name.description: Unique identifier of the Load Balancer type

description.description: Description of the Load Balancer type

max_connections.description: Number of maximum simultaneous open connections

max_services.description: Number of services a Load Balancer of this type can have

max_targets.description: Number of targets a single Load Balancer can have

max_assigned_certificates.description: Number of SSL Certificates that can be assigned to a single Load Balancer

deprecated.description: Point in time when the Load Balancer type is deprecated (in ISO-8601 format)

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country the Location resides in

city.description: City the Location is closest to

latitude.description: Latitude of the city closest to the Location

longitude.description: Longitude of the city closest to the Location

network_zone.description: Name of network zone this Location resides in

location.description: Location where the Datacenter resides in | Location the Floating IP was created in. Routing is optimized for this Location.

start.description: Start of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format)

end.description: End of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format)

time_series.description: Hash with timeseries information, containing the name of timeseries as key

metrics.description: You must specify the type of metric to get: open_connections, requests_per_second or bandwidth. You can also specify more than one type by comma separation, e.g. requests_per_second,bandwidth. Depending on the type you will get different time series data.

ip_range.description: IPv4 prefix of the whole Network

subnets.description: Array subnets allocated in this Network

routes.description: Array of routes set in this Network

servers.description: Array of IDs of Servers attached to this Network

load_balancers.description: Array of IDs of Load Balancers attached to this Network

delete.description: If true, prevents the Network from being deleted

created.description: Point in time when the Network was created (in ISO-8601 format)

price.description: Hourly costs for a Resource in this Location | Monthly costs for a Resource in this Location | Hourly costs for a Server type in this Location | Monthly costs for a Server type in this Location | Hourly costs for a Load Balancer type in this network zone | Monthly costs for a Load Balancer type in this network zone

location.description: Name of the Location the price is for

delete.description: If true, prevents the Server from being deleted

rebuild.description: If true, prevents the Server from being rebuilt

ip.description: IP address (v4) of this Load Balancer
IP address (v6) of this Load Balancer

floating_ips.description: IDs of Floating IPs assigned to this Server

public_net_server.description: Public network information. The Server's IPv4 address can be found in `public_net->ipv4->ip`

image.description: ID or name of Image to rebuilt from.

root_password.description: New root password when not using SSH keys

server.description: Configuration for type Server, required if type is `server`

label_selector.description: Configuration for label selector targets, required if type is `label_selector`

ip.description: IP of a server that belongs to the same customer (public IPv4/IPv6).

IP targets where the traffic should be routed through. Currently it is only possible to use the IPs of Hetzner Online Root Servers belonging to the project owner. IPs belonging to other users are blocked. Additionally IPs belonging to services provided by Hetzner Cloud (Servers, Load Balancers, ...) are blocked as well.

type.description: Destination Image type to convert to

wss_url.description: URL of websocket proxy to use; this includes a token which is valid for a limited time only

password.description: VNC password to use for this connection (this password only works in combination with a wss_url with valid token)

root_password.description: Password that will be set for this Server once the Action succeeds

size.description: New Volume size in GB (must be greater than current size)

destination.description: Destination network or host of this route. Must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first IP of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1. Must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918.

gateway.description: Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first IP of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1 as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of Servers. | Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first IP of the networks ip_range, an IP behind a vSwitch or 172.31.1.1, as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of Servers.

route.description: Request for POST https://api.hetzner.cloud/v1/networks/{id}/actions/add_route | Request for POST https://api.hetzner.cloud/v1/networks/{id}/actions/delete_route

name.description: Name of the Server (must be unique per Project and a valid hostname as per RFC 1123)

created.description: Point in time when the Server was created (in ISO-8601 format)

rescue_enabled.description: True if rescue mode is enabled. Server will then boot into rescue system on next reboot

locked.description: True if Server has been locked and is not available to user

backup_window.description: Time window (UTC) in which the backup will run, or null if the backups are not enabled

outgoing_traffic.description: Outbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

ingoing_traffic.description: Inbound Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

included_traffic.description: Free Traffic for the current billing period in bytes

volumes.description: IDs of Volumes assigned to this Server

server.description: Servers are virtual machines that can be provisioned.

name.description: Unique identifier of the Server type

cores.description: Number of cpu cores a Server of this type will have

memory.description: Memory a Server of this type will have in GB

disk.description: Disk size a Server of this type will have in GB

deprecated.description: True if Server type is deprecated

storage_type.description: Type of Server boot drive. Local has higher speed. Network has better availability.

server_type.description: Type of Server - determines how much ram, disk and cpu a Server has

listen_port.description: Port the Load Balancer listens on

destination_port.description: Port the Load Balancer will balance to

port.description: Port the health check will be performed on

interval.description: Time interval in seconds health checks are performed

timeout.description: Time in seconds after an attempt is considered a timeout

retries.description: Unsuccessful retries needed until a target is considered unhealthy

domain.description: Host header to send in the HTTP request. May not contain spaces, percent or backslash symbols. Can be null, in that case no host header is sent.

path.description: HTTP path to use for health checks

response.description: String that must be contained in HTTP response in order to pass the health check

status_codes.description: List of returned HTTP status codes in order to pass the health check. Supports the wildcards `?` for exactly one character and `*` for multiple ones. The default is to pass the health check for any status code between 2?? and 3??.

allOf.description: Health check that belong to this service

service.description: A service for a Load Balancer.

name.description: Name of the SSH key (must be unique per Project)

created.description: Point in time when the SSH key was created (in ISO-8601 format)

ssh_key.description: SSH keys are public keys you provide to the cloud system. They can be injected into Servers at creation time. We highly recommend that you use keys instead of passwords to manage your Servers.

ip_range.description: Range to allocate IPs from. Must be a Subnet of the ip_range of the parent network object and must not overlap with any other subnets or with any destinations in routes. If the Subnet is of type vSwitch, it also can not overlap with any gateway in routes. Minimum Network size is /30. We suggest that you pick a bigger Network with a /24 netmask.

network_zone.description: Name of Network zone. Currently eu-central is the only available zone.

vswitch_id.description: ID of the robot vSwitch. Must be supplied if the subnet is of type vswitch.

subnet.description: Subnets divide the ip_range from the parent Network object into multiple Subnetworks that you can use for different specific purposes.

ip_range.description: Range to allocate IPs from. Must be a Subnet of the ip_range of the parent network object and must not overlap with any other subnets or with any destinations in routes. Minimum Network size is /30. We suggest that you pick a bigger Network with a /24 netmask.

network_zone.description: Name of Network zone. Currently eu-central is the only available zone.

gateway.description: Gateway for Servers attached to this subnet. For subnets of type Server this is always the first IP of the network IP range.

server.description: Server where the traffic should be routed through

health_status.description: List of health statuses of the services on this target

use_private_ip.description: Use the private network IP instead of the public IP. Default value is false.

label_selector.description: Label selector and a list of selected targets

ip.description: IP of a server that belongs to the same customer (public IPv4/IPv6).

IP targets where the traffic should be routed through. Currently it is only possible to use the IPs of Hetzner Online Root Servers belonging to the project owner. IPs belonging to other users are blocked. Additionally IPs belonging to services provided by Hetzner Cloud (Servers, Load Balancers, ...) are blocked as well.

target.description: A target for a load balancer

created.description: Point in time when the Volume was created (in ISO-8601 format)

server.description: ID of the Server the Volume is attached to, null if it is not attached at all

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country the Location resides in

city.description: City the Location is closest to

latitude.description: Latitude of the city closest to the Location

longitude.description: Longitude of the city closest to the Location

network_zone.description: Name of network zone this Location resides in

allOf.description: Location of the Volume. Volume can only be attached to Servers in the same Location.

size.description: Size in GB of the Volume

linux_device.description: Device path on the file system for the Volume

delete.description: If true, prevents the Volume from being deleted

format.description: Filesystem of the Volume if formatted on creation, null if not formatted on creation

volume.description: A Volume is a highly-available, scalable, and SSD-based block storage for Servers. Pricing for Volumes depends on the Volume size and Location, not the actual used storage. Please see [Hetzner Wiki](https://wiki.hetzner.de/index.php/CloudServer/en#Volumes) for more details about Volumes.

get.description: Returns all Action objects. You can `sort` the results by using the sort URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified IDs

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.description: Returns a specific Action object.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply has this structure

get.description: Returns all Certificate objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

200.description: The `certificates` key contains an array of Certificate objects

post.description: Creates a new Certificate.

201.description: The `certificate` key contains the Certificate that was just created

get.description: Gets a specific Certificate object.

200.description: The `certificate` key contains a Certificate object

put.description:
Updates the Certificate properties.

Note that when updating labels, the Certificates current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

Note: if the Certificate object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

200.description: The `certificate` key contains the Certificate that was just updated

delete.description: Deletes a Certificate.

get.description: Returns all Datacenter objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter Datacenters by their name. The response will only contain the Datacenter matching the specified name. When the name does not match the Datacenter name format, an `invalid_input` error is returned.

200.description: The reply contains the `datacenters` and `recommendation` keys

get.description: Returns a specific Datacenter object.

200.description: The `datacenter` key in the reply contains a Datacenter object with this structure

get.description: Returns all Floating IP objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter Floating IPs by their name. The response will only contain the Floating IP matching the specified name.

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter Floating IPs by labels. The response will only contain Floating IPs matching the label selector.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times. Choices id id:asc id:desc created created:asc created:desc

200.description: The `floating_ips` key in the reply contains an array of Floating IP objects with this structure

post.description: Creates a new Floating IP assigned to a Server. If you want to create a Floating IP that is not bound to a Server, you need to provide the `home_location` key instead of `server`. This can be either the ID or the name of the Location this IP shall be created in. Note that a Floating IP can be assigned to a Server in any Location later on. For optimal routing it is advised to use the Floating IP in the same Location it was created in.

requestBody.description: The `type` argument is required while `home_location` and `server` are mutually exclusive.

201.description: The `floating_ip` key in the reply contains the object that was just created

get.description: Returns a specific Floating IP object.

200.description: The `floating_ip` key in the reply contains a Floating IP object with this structure

put.description:
Updates the description or labels of a Floating IP.
Also note that when updating labels, the Floating IPs current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

200.description: The `floating_ip` key in the reply contains the modified Floating IP object with the new description

delete.description: Deletes a Floating IP. If it is currently assigned to a Server it will automatically get unassigned.

get.summary: Get all Actions for a Floating IP
get.description: Returns all Action objects for a Floating IP. You can sort the results by using the `sort` URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.summary: Get an Action for a Floating IP
get.description: Returns a specific Action object for a Floating IP.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply has this structure

post.summary: Assign a Floating IP to a Server
post.description: Assigns a Floating IP to a Server.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `assign` Action

post.description: Unassigns a Floating IP, resulting in it being unreachable. You may assign it to a Server again at a later time.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `unassign` Action

post.summary: Change reverse DNS entry for a Floating IP
post.description: Changes the hostname that will appear when getting the hostname belonging to this Floating IP.

requestBody.description:
Select the IP address for which to change the DNS entry by passing `ip`. For a Floating IP of type `ipv4` this must exactly match the IP address of the Floating IP. For a Floating IP of type `ipv6` this must be a single IP within the IPv6 /64 range that belongs to this Floating IP.

The target hostname is set by passing `dns_ptr`.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_dns_ptr` Action

post.description: Changes the protection configuration of the Floating IP.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_protection` Action

get.description: Returns all Image objects. You can select specific Image types only and sort the results by using URI parameters.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times. The response will only contain Images matching the status.

parameters.name: bound_to
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times. Server ID linked to the Image. Only available for Images of type `backup`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

200.description: The `images` key in the reply contains an array of Image objects with this structure

get.description: Returns a specific Image object.

200.description: The `image` key in the reply contains an Image object with this structure

put.description:
Updates the Image. You may change the description, convert a Backup Image to a Snapshot Image or change the Image labels. Only Images of type `snapshot` and `backup` can be updated.

Note that when updating labels, the current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

200.description: The image key in the reply contains the modified Image object

delete.description: Deletes an Image. Only Images of type `snapshot` and `backup` can be deleted.

get.summary: Get all Actions for an Image
get.description: Returns all Action objects for an Image. You can sort the results by using the `sort` URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.summary: Get an Action for an Image
get.description: Returns a specific Action for an Image.

200.description: The `action` key contains the Image Action

post.description: Changes the protection configuration of the Image. Can only be used on snapshots.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_protection` Action

get.description: Returns all available ISO objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter ISOs by their name. The response will only contain the ISO matching the specified name.

200.description: The `isos` key in the reply contains an array of iso objects with this structure

get.description: Returns a specific ISO object.

200.description: The `iso` key in the reply contains an array of ISO objects with this structure

get.description: Gets all existing Load Balancers that you have available.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

200.description: The `load_balancers` key contains a list of Load Balancers

post.description:
Creates a Load Balancer.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                                    | Description                                                                                           |
|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `cloud_resource_ip_not_allowed`         | The IP you are trying to add as a target belongs to a Hetzner Cloud resource                          |
| `ip_not_owned`                          | The IP is not owned by the owner of the project of the Load Balancer                                  |
| `load_balancer_not_attached_to_network` | The Load Balancer is not attached to a network                                                        |
| `robot_unavailable`                     | Robot was not available. The caller may retry the operation after a short delay.                      |
| `server_not_attached_to_network`        | The server you are trying to add as a target is not attached to the same network as the Load Balancer |
| `source_port_already_used`              | The source port you are trying to add is already in use                                               |
| `target_already_defined`                | The Load Balancer target you are trying to define is already defined                                  |

201.description: The `load_balancer` key contains the Load Balancer that was just created

get.description: Gets a specific Load Balancer object.

200.description: The `load_balancer` key contains the Load Balancer

put.description:
Updates a Load Balancer. You can update a Load Balancers name and a Load Balancers labels.

Note that when updating labels, the Load Balancers current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

Note: if the Load Balancer object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

200.description: The `load_balancer` key contains the updated Load Balancer

delete.description: Deletes a Load Balancer.

get.description:
You must specify the type of metric to get: `open_connections`, `connections_per_second`, `requests_per_second` or `bandwidth`. You can also specify more than one type by comma separation, e.g. `requests_per_second,bandwidth`.

Depending on the type you will get different time series data:

|Type | Timeseries | Unit | Description |
|---- |------------|------|-------------|
| open_connections | open_connections | number | Open connections |
| connections_per_second | connections_per_second | connections/s | Connections per second |
| requests_per_second | requests_per_second | requests/s | Requests per second |
| bandwidth | bandwidth.in | bytes/s | Ingress bandwidth |
|| bandwidth.out | bytes/s | Egress bandwidth |

Metrics are available for the last 30 days only.

If you do not provide the step argument we will automatically adjust it so that 200 samples are returned.

We limit the number of samples to a maximum of 500 and will adjust the step parameter accordingly.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

200.description: The `metrics` key in the reply contains a metrics object with this structure

parameters.name: status

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

| `load_balancer_not_attached_to_network` | The Load Balancer is not attached to a network                                                        |
| `robot_unavailable`                     | Robot was not available. The caller may retry the operation after a short delay.                      |

200.description: The `load_balancer_type` key in the reply contains a Load Balancer type object with this structure

200.description: The `locations` key in the reply contains an array of Location objects with this structure

get.description: Returns a specific Location object.

get.description: Gets all existing networks that you have available.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter networks by their name. The response will only contain the networks matching the specified name.

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter networks by labels. The response will only contain networks with a matching label selector pattern.

200.description: The `networks` key contains a list of networks

post.description:
Creates a network with the specified `ip_range`.

You may specify one or more `subnets`. You can also add more Subnets later by using the [add subnet action](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#network-actions-add-a-subnet-to-a-network). If you do not specify an `ip_range` in the subnet we will automatically pick the first available /24 range for you.

You may specify one or more routes in `routes`. You can also add more routes later by using the [add route action](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#network-actions-add-a-route-to-a-network).

201.description: The `network` key contains the network that was just created

get.description: Gets a specific network object.

200.description: The `network` key contains the network

put.description:
Updates the network properties.

Note that when updating labels, the networks current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

Note: if the network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

200.description: The `network` key contains the updated network

delete.description:
Deletes a network. If there are Servers attached they will be detached in the background.

Note: if the network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

get.summary: Get all Actions for a Network
get.description: Returns all Action objects for a Network. You can sort the results by using the `sort` URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.summary: Get an Action for a Network
get.description: Returns a specific Action for a Network.

200.description: The `action` key contains the Network Action

post.summary: Add a subnet to a Network
post.description:
Adds a new subnet object to the Network. If you do not specify an `ip_range` for the subnet we will automatically pick the first available /24 range for you if possible.

Note: if the parent Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `add_subnet` Action

post.summary: Delete a subnet from a Network
post.description:
Deletes a single subnet entry from a Network. You cannot delete subnets which still have Servers attached. If you have Servers attached you first need to detach all Servers that use IPs from this subnet before you can delete the subnet.

Note: if the Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `delete_subnet` Action

post.summary: Add a route to a Network
post.description:
Adds a route entry to a Network.

Note: if the Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `add_route` Action

post.summary: Delete a route from a Network
post.description:
Delete a route entry from a Network.

Note: if the Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `delete_route` Action

post.summary: Change IP range of a Network
post.description:
Changes the IP range of a Network. IP ranges can only be extended and never shrunk. You can only add IPs at the end of an existing IP range. This means that the IP part of your existing range must stay the same and you can only change its netmask.

For example if you have a range `10.0.0.0/16` you want to extend then your new range must also start with the IP `10.0.0.0`. Your CIDR netmask `/16` may change to a number that is smaller than `16` thereby increasing the IP range. So valid entries would be `10.0.0.0/15`, `10.0.0.0/14`, `10.0.0.0/13` and so on.

After changing the IP range you will have to adjust the routes on your connected Servers by either rebooting them or manually changing the routes to your private Network interface.

Note: if the Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_ip_range` Action

post.description:
Changes the protection configuration of a Network.

Note: if the Network object changes during the request, the response will be a conflict error.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_protection` Action

get.description:
Returns prices for all resources available on the platform. VAT and currency of the Project owner are used for calculations.

Both net and gross prices are included in the response.

200.description: The `pricing` key in the reply contains an pricing object with this structure

get.description: Returns all existing Server objects

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times. The response will only contain Server matching the status

200.description: A paged array of servers

x-next.description: A link to the next page of responses

post.description: Creates a new Server. Returns preliminary information about the Server as well as an Action that covers progress of creation.

requestBody.description:
Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes).

For `server_type` you can either use the ID as listed in `/server_types` or its name.

For `image` you can either use the ID as listed in `/images` or its name.

If you want to create the Server in a Location, you must set `location` to the ID or name as listed in `/locations`. This is the recommended way. You can be even more specific by setting `datacenter` to the ID or name as listed in `/datacenters`. However directly specifying the Datacenter is discouraged since supply availability in Datacenters varies greatly and Datacenters may be out of stock for extended periods of time or not serve certain Server types at all.

Some properties like `start_after_create` or `automount` will trigger Actions after the Server is created. Those Actions are listed in the `next_actions` field in the response.

For accessing your Server we strongly recommend to use SSH keys by passing the respective key IDs in `ssh_keys`. If you do not specify any `ssh_keys` we will generate a root password for you and return it in the response.

Please note that provided user-data is stored in our systems. While we take measures to protect it we highly recommend that you dont use it to store passwords or other sensitive information.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                              |
|-------------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| `placement_error`             | An error during the placement occurred   |

201.description: The `server` key in the reply contains a Server object with this structure

get.description: Returns a specific Server object. The Server must exist inside the Project

200.description: The `server` key in the reply contains a Server object with this structure

put.description:
Updates a Server. You can update a Servers name and a Servers labels.
Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes).
Also note that when updating labels, the Servers current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

200.description: The `server` key in the reply contains the updated Server

delete.description: Deletes a Server. This immediately removes the Server from your account, and it is no longer accessible.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

get.description:
Get Metrics for specified Server.

You must specify the type of metric to get: cpu, disk or network. You can also specify more than one type by comma separation, e.g. cpu,disk.

Depending on the type you will get different time series data

| Type    | Timeseries              | Unit      | Description                                          |
|---------|-------------------------|-----------|------------------------------------------------------|
| cpu     | cpu                     | percent   | Percent CPU usage                                    |
| disk    | disk.0.iops.read        | iop/s     | Number of read IO operations per second              |
|         | disk.0.iops.write       | iop/s     | Number of write IO operations per second             |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.read   | bytes/s   | Bytes read per second                                |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.write  | bytes/s   | Bytes written per second                             |
| network | network.0.pps.in        | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second received |
|         | network.0.pps.out       | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second sent     |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.in  | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s received            |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.out | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s sent                |

Metrics are available for the last 30 days only.

If you do not provide the step argument we will automatically adjust it so that a maximum of 200 samples are returned.

We limit the number of samples returned to a maximum of 500 and will adjust the step parameter accordingly.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

200.description: The `metrics` key in the reply contains a metrics object with this structure

get.summary: Get all Actions for a Server
get.description: Returns all Action objects for a Server. You can `sort` the results by using the sort URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.summary: Get an Action for a Server
get.description: Returns a specific Action object for a Server.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply has this structure

post.description: Starts a Server by turning its power on.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Reboots a Server gracefully by sending an ACPI request. The Server operating system must support ACPI and react to the request, otherwise the Server will not reboot.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Cuts power to a Server and starts it again. This forcefully stops it without giving the Server operating system time to gracefully stop. This may lead to data loss, its equivalent to pulling the power cord and plugging it in again. Reset should only be used when reboot does not work.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Shuts down a Server gracefully by sending an ACPI shutdown request. The Server operating system must support ACPI and react to the request, otherwise the Server will not shut down.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Cuts power to the Server. This forcefully stops it without giving the Server operating system time to gracefully stop. May lead to data loss, equivalent to pulling the power cord. Power off should only be used when shutdown does not work.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Reset root Password of a Server
post.description:
Resets the root password. Only works for Linux systems that are running the qemu guest agent. Server must be powered on (state `on`) in order for this operation to succeed.

This will generate a new password for this Server and return it.

If this does not succeed you can use the rescue system to netboot the Server and manually change your Server password by hand.

201.description:
The `root_password` key in the reply contains the new root password that will be active if the Action succeeds.

The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure:

post.summary: Enable Rescue Mode for a Server
post.description:
Enable the Hetzner Rescue System for this Server. The next time a Server with enabled rescue mode boots it will start a special minimal Linux distribution designed for repair and reinstall.

In case a Server cannot boot on its own you can use this to access a Servers disks.

Rescue Mode is automatically disabled when you first boot into it or if you do not use it for 60 minutes.

Enabling rescue mode will not [reboot](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#server-actions-soft-reboot-a-server) your Server  you will have to do this yourself.

201.description:
The `root_password` key in the reply contains the root password that can be used to access the booted rescue system.

The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Disable Rescue Mode for a Server
post.description:
Disables the Hetzner Rescue System for a Server. This makes a Server start from its disks on next reboot.

Rescue Mode is automatically disabled when you first boot into it or if you do not use it for 60 minutes.

Disabling rescue mode will not reboot your Server  you will have to do this yourself.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description:
Creates an Image (snapshot) from a Server by copying the contents of its disks. This creates a snapshot of the current state of the disk and copies it into an Image. If the Server is currently running you must make sure that its disk content is consistent. Otherwise, the created Image may not be readable.

To make sure disk content is consistent, we recommend to shut down the Server prior to creating an Image.

You can either create a `backup` Image that is bound to the Server and therefore will be deleted when the Server is deleted, or you can create an `snapshot` Image which is completely independent of the Server it was created from and will survive Server deletion. Backup Images are only available when the backup option is enabled for the Server. Snapshot Images are billed on a per GB basis.

201.description:
The `image` key in the reply contains an the created Image, which is an object with this structure

The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Rebuild a Server from an Image
post.description:
Rebuilds a Server overwriting its disk with the content of an Image, thereby **destroying all data** on the target Server

The Image can either be one you have created earlier (`backup` or `snapshot` Image) or it can be a completely fresh `system` Image provided by us. You can get a list of all available Images with `GET /images`.

Your Server will automatically be powered off before the rebuild command executes.

requestBody.description: To select which Image to rebuild from you can either pass an ID or a name as the `image` argument. Passing a name only works for `system` Images since the other Image types do not have a name set.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Change the Type of a Server
post.description:
Changes the type (Cores, RAM and disk sizes) of a Server.

Server must be powered off for this command to succeed.

This copies the content of its disk, and starts it again.

You can only migrate to Server types with the same `storage_type` and equal or bigger disks. Shrinking disks is not possible as it might destroy data.

If the disk gets upgraded, the Server type can not be downgraded any more. If you plan to downgrade the Server type, set `upgrade_disk` to `false`.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `invalid_server_type`         | The server type does not fit for the given server or is deprecated   |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The action requires a stopped server                                 |

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Enable and Configure Backups for a Server
post.description:
Enables and configures the automatic daily backup option for the Server. Enabling automatic backups will increase the price of the Server by 20%. In return, you will get seven slots where Images of type backup can be stored.

Backups are automatically created daily.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description:
Disables the automatic backup option and deletes all existing Backups for a Server. No more additional charges for backups will be made.

Caution: This immediately removes all existing backups for the Server!

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Attach an ISO to a Server
post.description:
Attaches an ISO to a Server. The Server will immediately see it as a new disk. An already attached ISO will automatically be detached before the new ISO is attached.

Servers with attached ISOs have a modified boot order: They will try to boot from the ISO first before falling back to hard disk.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Detach an ISO from a Server
post.description: Detaches an ISO from a Server. In case no ISO Image is attached to the Server, the status of the returned Action is immediately set to `success`

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Change reverse DNS entry for this Server
post.description:
Changes the hostname that will appear when getting the hostname belonging to the primary IPs (IPv4 and IPv6) of this Server.

Floating IPs assigned to the Server are not affected by this.

requestBody.description: Select the IP address for which to change the DNS entry by passing `ip`. It can be either IPv4 or IPv6. The target hostname is set by passing `dns_ptr`.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Changes the protection configuration of the Server.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.description: Requests credentials for remote access via VNC over websocket to keyboard, monitor, and mouse for a Server. The provided URL is valid for 1 minute, after this period a new url needs to be created to connect to the Server. How long the connection is open after the initial connect is not subject to this timeout.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Attach a Server to a Network
post.description:
Attaches a Server to a network. This will complement the fixed public Server interface by adding an additional ethernet interface to the Server which is connected to the specified network.

The Server will get an IP auto assigned from a subnet of type `server` in the same `network_zone`.

Using the `alias_ips` attribute you can also define one or more additional IPs to the Servers. Please note that you will have to configure these IPs by hand on your Server since only the primary IP will be given out by DHCP.

**Call specific error codes**

| Code                             | Description                                                           |
|----------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `server_already_attached`        | The server is already attached to the network                         |
| `ip_not_available`               | The provided Network IP is not available                              |
| `no_subnet_available`            | No Subnet or IP is available for the Server within the network        |
| `networks_overlap`               | The network IP range overlaps with one of the server networks         |

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Detach a Server from a Network
post.description: Detaches a Server from a network. The interface for this network will vanish.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

post.summary: Change alias IPs of a Network
post.description: Changes the alias IPs of an already attached Network. Note that the existing aliases for the specified Network will be replaced with these provided in the request body. So if you want to add an alias IP, you have to provide the existing ones from the Network plus the new alias IP in the request body.

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

get.description: Gets all Server type objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter Server types by their name. The response will only contain the Server type matching the specified name.

200.description: The `server_types` key in the reply contains an array of Server type objects with this structure

get.description: Gets a specific Server type object.

200.description: The `server_type` key in the reply contains a Server type object with this structure

get.description: Returns all SSH key objects.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: fingerprint
parameters.description: Can be used to filter SSH keys by their fingerprint. The response will only contain the SSH key matching the specified fingerprint.

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

200.description: The `ssh_keys` key in the reply contains an array of SSH key objects with this structure

post.description: Creates a new SSH key with the given `name` and `public_key`. Once an SSH key is created, it can be used in other calls such as creating Servers.

201.description: The `ssh_key` key in the reply contains the object that was just created

get.description: Returns a specific SSH key object.

200.description: The `ssh_key` key in the reply contains an SSH key object with this structure

put.description:
Updates an SSH key. You can update an SSH key name and an SSH key labels.

Please note that when updating labels, the SSH key current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

200.description: The `ssh_key` key in the reply contains the modified SSH key object with the new description

delete.description: Deletes an SSH key. It cannot be used anymore.

get.description: Gets all existing Volumes that you have available.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times. The response will only contain Volumes matching the status.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by their name. The response will only contain the resources matching the specified name

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Can be used to filter resources by labels. The response will only contain resources matching the label selector.

200.description: The `volumes` key contains a list of volumes

post.description:
Creates a new Volume attached to a Server. If you want to create a Volume that is not attached to a Server, you need to provide the `location` key instead of `server`. This can be either the ID or the name of the Location this Volume will be created in. Note that a Volume can be attached to a Server only in the same Location as the Volume itself.

Specifying the Server during Volume creation will automatically attach the Volume to that Server after it has been initialized. In that case, the `next_actions` key in the response is an array which contains a single `attach_volume` action.

The minimum Volume size is 10GB and the maximum size is 10TB (10240GB).

A volumes name can consist of alphanumeric characters, dashes, underscores, and dots, but has to start and end with an alphanumeric character. The total length is limited to 64 characters. Volume names must be unique per Project.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                                | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `no_space_left_in_location`         | There is no volume space left in the given location                    |

201.description:
The `volume` key contains the Volume that was just created

The `action` key contains the Action tracking Volume creation

get.description: Gets a specific Volume object.

200.description: The `volume` key contains the volume

put.description:
Updates the Volume properties.

Note that when updating labels, the volumes current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Volume to update

200.description: The `volume` key contains the updated volume

delete.description: Deletes a volume. All Volume data is irreversibly destroyed. The Volume must not be attached to a Server and it must not have delete protection enabled.

get.summary: Get all Actions for a Volume
get.description: Returns all Action objects for a Volume. You can `sort` the results by using the sort URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be used multiple times, the response will contain only Actions with specified statuses

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

get.summary: Get an Action for a Volume
get.description: Returns a specific Action for a Volume.

200.description: The `action` key contains the Volume Action

post.description: Attaches a Volume to a Server. Works only if the Server is in the same Location as the Volume.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `attach_volume` Action

post.description: Detaches a Volume from the Server its attached to. You may attach it to a Server again at a later time.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `detach_volume` Action

post.description: Changes the size of a Volume. Note that downsizing a Volume is not possible.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `resize_volume` Action

post.description: Changes the protection configuration of a Volume.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_protection` Action
